ORDER_MED.name: ORDER_MED
ORDER_MED.description: The ORDER_MED table enables you to report on medications ordered in EpicCare (prescriptions). We have also included patient and contact identification information for each record.

columns.name: ORDER_MED_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order record associated with this medication order. This is an internal unique identifier for ORD master file records in this table and cannot be used to link to CLARITY_MEDICATION.

columns.name: PAT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the patient record for this line. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique, internal contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of the contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number (CSN) for the patient contact associated with this medication order. This number is unique across patients and encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).

columns.name: ORDERING_DATE
columns.description: The date when the medication order was placed.

columns.name: ORDER_CLASS_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the order class. This value is used to define how clinical systems process the order.

columns.name: PHARMACY_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the pharmacy record that is associated with this medication order. This column is frequently used to link to the RX_PHR table. This field is only populated if the clinical system user selects a specific pharmacy from the  list, otherwise the field is null. This field is only populated by the ambulatory clinical system, not the pharmacy system.

columns.name: PHARMACY_ID_PHARMACY_NAME
columns.description: The name of the pharmacy.

columns.name: ORD_CREATR_USER_ID
columns.description: The EMP ID (.1) of the user who signed the order (for a non-signed and held order) or the last person who performed a sign and hold or release action for a signed and held order.

columns.name: ORD_CREATR_USER_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

columns.name: MEDICATION_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the medication record that is associated with this order. In some circumstances, for example when Intelligent Medication Selection selects an IMS mixture, this column may contain template records that do not represent real medications. For this reason, it is recommended to use the Clarity column ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID when reporting on medication orders.

columns.name: DESCRIPTION
columns.description: The description of the order. This information is found in the Order field of clinical systemï¿½s Order Detail window.

columns.name: QUANTITY
columns.description: The quantity of the prescription being dispensed as entered by the user.

columns.name: REFILLS
columns.description: The number of refills allowed for this prescription as entered by the user.

columns.name: START_DATE
columns.description: The date when the medication order started. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: END_DATE
columns.description: The date when the medication order is to end.

columns.name: DISP_AS_WRITTEN_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether or not the prescription should be dispensed as written for this medication.

columns.name: RSN_FOR_DISCON_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the reason a prescription has been discontinued.  This column contains data only in prescription orders that have been discontinued.

columns.name: MED_PRESC_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who has prescribed or authorized the medication order. The value in this column matches the value in the AUTHRZING_PROV_ID column.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: The date and time when this row was created or last updated in Clarity.

columns.name: ORDER_INST
columns.description: The date and time the order was placed. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: DISPLAY_NAME
columns.description: The name of the medication as it appears on the medication record itself.

columns.name: HV_HOSPITALIST_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether  this is a hospitalist order. A Y indicates a hospitalist order.

columns.name: ORDER_PRIORITY_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the priority assigned to an order.

columns.name: MED_ROUTE_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the route of administration of a medication.

columns.name: DISCON_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who discontinued the order.

columns.name: DISCON_USER_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

columns.name: DISCON_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the medication order was discontinued. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: CHNG_ORDER_MED_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the changed or reordered medication order that this order replaced. This column is frequently used to link back to the ORDER_MED table.

columns.name: PEND_APPR_USER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user who approved a pended order.

columns.name: PEND_APPR_USER_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

columns.name: HV_DISCR_FREQ_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the discrete frequency record associated with this medication order. This column is frequently used to link to the IP_FREQUENCY table.

columns.name: HV_DISCR_FREQ_ID_FREQ_NAME
columns.description: The name of the frequency record.

columns.name: HV_DISCRETE_DOSE
columns.description: The discrete dose for a medication as entered by the user in the orders activity.

columns.name: HV_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the dosage unit of a medication.

columns.name: ORDER_START_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the medication order is to start. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: ORDER_END_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the medication order is scheduled to end. The date appears in calendar format.

columns.name: ORDER_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the current status of an order.

columns.name: AUTHRZING_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who has prescribed or authorized the medication order. The value in this column matches the value in the MED_PRESC_PROV_ID column.

columns.name: ORD_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider listed as the ordering provider.

columns.name: MIN_DISCRETE_DOSE
columns.description: The minimum ordered dose amount for the medication as specified by the user in the orders activity.

columns.name: DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the dose unit of a medication.

columns.name: PROVIDER_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description: The medication provider type category number for the order.  This item distinguishes between authorizing and documenting provider types for historical and non-historical medications.  If the medication was ordered as historical, the provider is considered the documenting provider and is reflected as such in this item.  If the medication was not ordered as historical, the provider is considered the authorizing provider is reflected in this item as such.

columns.name: MODIFY_TRACK_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the flag that both indicates and distinguishes whether an order was reordered or modified.

columns.name: ACT_ORDER_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number indicating additional information about an order's status--Active, Completed, Discontinued, or Cancelled. An active order is any order that has not been completed, discontinued, cancelled, pended, or signed and held.

columns.name: USER_SEL_MED_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the orderable medication that is evaluated for Intelligent Medication Selection (IMS). This item is blank if the order is not evaluated for IMS.  It is recommended to use the Clarity column ORDER_MEDINFO.DISPENSABLE_MED_ID when reporting on medication orders. Use USER_SEL_MED_ID if searching for medication orders that were evaluated by IMS.

columns.name: USER_SEL_ERX_DAT
columns.description: The date that the medication record was actually selected by the user.  This item is populated only if Intelligent Medication Selection (IMS) replaced the original user-selected medication with another medication record.

columns.name: MDL_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the medication problem list record that is associated with this medication order. This column is frequently used to link to the MDL_MD_PRBLM_LIST table.

columns.name: LASTDOSE
columns.description: Comments for the last administered dose of a medication entered in the medication documentation navigator section.

columns.name: AMB_MED_DISP_NAME
columns.description: The name of the ambulatory medication.

columns.name: WEIGHT_BASED_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the dose for this medication order is based on the patient's weight.

columns.name: REFILLS_REMAINING
columns.description: The number of refills remaining in the medication.

columns.name: MED_REFILL_PROV_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the provider who authorized the medication refill order.

columns.name: ORDERING_MODE_C_NAME
columns.description: The category number for the ordering mode of the order (i.e. Outpatient, Inpatient).  Note that Outpatient orders can be placed from an Inpatient encounter as discharge orders / take-home prescriptions.  This column might be blank for Outpatient orders placed prior to the creation of the IP module.

columns.name: PEND_APPROVE_FLAG_C_NAME
columns.description: The pending medication approval status category number for the order.

columns.name: EXT_ELG_SOURCE_ID
columns.description: External eligibility source ID

columns.name: EXT_ELG_MEMBER_ID
columns.description: External eligibility member ID

columns.name: EXT_FORMULARY_ID
columns.description: External formulary ID

columns.name: EXT_COVERAGE_ID
columns.description: External coverage ID

columns.name: EXT_PHARMACY_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description: External pharmacy type

columns.name: EXT_FORMULARY_STAT
columns.description: External Formulary Status

columns.name: EXT_COV_AGE_LMT_YN
columns.description: External coverage age limits

columns.name: EXT_COV_EXCLUS_YN
columns.description: External coverage product coverage exclusion

columns.name: EXT_COV_SEX_LMT_YN
columns.description: External coverage gender limits

columns.name: EXT_COV_MED_NCST_YN
columns.description: External coverage medical necessity

columns.name: EXT_COV_PRI_AUTH_YN
columns.description: External coverage prior authorization

columns.name: EXT_COV_QNTY_LMT_YN
columns.description: External coverage quantity limits

columns.name: EXT_COV_LNK_DRUG_YN
columns.description: External coverage resource link drug

columns.name: EXT_COV_LNK_SMRY_YN
columns.description: External coverage resource link summary

columns.name: EXT_COV_STEP_MED_YN
columns.description: External coverage step medication

columns.name: EXT_COV_STEP_THR_YN
columns.description: External coverage step therapy

columns.name: USR_SEL_IMS_YN
columns.description: This item stores whether the product to use with IMS was selected by the user or chosen automatically.  Yes means the user chose the product, No means the product was selected automatically.

columns.name: INST_OF_UPDATE_TM
columns.description: The day and time the order record was last updated.

columns.name: PEND_ACTION_C_NAME
columns.description: The manner in which the medication was reordered, such as reorder from order review or reorder from the medications activity.

columns.name: MED_DIS_DISP_QTY
columns.description: This item stores the discrete dispense quantity when discrete dispense is enabled.

columns.name: MED_DIS_DISP_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description: This item stores the discrete dispense unit when discrete dispense is enabled.

columns.name: BSA_BASED_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the dose for this medication order is based on the patient's body surface area (BSA).

columns.name: MED_LINKED_PROC_ID
columns.description: The linked procedure ID for the medication.  Depending on pharmacy billing configuration, you may have only one procedure ID (code) for all medications or many.

columns.name: MED_CNCT_DAT_REAL
columns.description: The real medication contact date (DAT) used in this order.

columns.name: CALC_VOLUME_YN
columns.description: Indicate if the volume is calculated.  "Y" means the volume is calculated. "N" means the volume is not calculated.  Default is "Y".

columns.name: CALC_MIN_DOSE
columns.description: The minimum calculated administer dose.

columns.name: CALC_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description: The dose unit for calculated administer dose.

columns.name: ADMIN_MIN_DOSE
columns.description: The minimum administer dose.

columns.name: ADMIN_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description: The dose unit for administer dose.

columns.name: ORDER_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description: Where in the system the order was placed from.
entries: Health Maintenance Single Care Gap Closure
Orders and Results Anywhere Network Interface
Imaging and Procedures - One Step Medications

columns.name: DFLT_DISCRETE_FREQ_NAME
columns.description: A flag to indicate if this order should default discrete ambulatory medication frequency information.

columns.name: DFLT_DISCRETE_DOSE_NAME
columns.description: A flag to indicate if this order should default discrete ambulatory medication dose information.

columns.name: MED_CONTACT_DT
columns.description: This is the order contact date in human readable form.

columns.name: DFLT_DISCRETE_C_NAME
columns.description: A flag to indicate if this orderï¿½should default discrete ambulatory medication information.

columns.name: PT_SIG_SMARTTEXT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the SmartText record used to generate medication instructions for the patient based on order details. A SmartText record is a text template that can contain text and dynamic data.

columns.name: PT_SIG_SMARTTEXT_ID_SMARTTEXT_NAME
columns.description: The name of the SmartText record.

columns.name: DISPENSABLE_MED_ID
columns.description: This is the unique ID of the medication that is the order's dispensable product. This column is frequently used to link to the CLARITY_MEDICATION table.  We recommend using this column in place of other similar columns to report on medication orders. Other columns that contain a medication ID in ORDER_MED and its addendum tables can contain orderable records or templates that do not represent real medications.  When Intelligent Medication Selection (IMS) runs for an order, this column will choose the medication record evaluated for IMS rather than the IMS mixture template.

columns.name: ONE_STEP_MED_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the order is a one-step medication, a medication whose administration is documented in one step.

columns.name: ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order record associated with this medication order. This is an internal unique identifier for order records in this table and cannot be used to link to CLARITY_MEDICATION.

columns.name: RX_WRITTEN_DATE
columns.description: Store the prescription written date, which is the date the prescription was entered into the system through EpicCare, or the date the prescription was written to the paper prescription.

columns.name: MED_DISCONT_ENC
columns.description: *** Deprecated *** The data in this column does not correctly link to PAT_ENC.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL. ORDER_MED_5.DISCON_PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL should be used for this link instead. ******

columns.name: PRIORITIZED_INST_TM
columns.description: The time and date that is used as the prioritized date.

columns.name: EXT_PHARM_MED_NAME
columns.description: Medication display name received from an external pharmacy.

columns.name: PEND_MED_ACTIVE_YN
columns.description: A flag to determine if this is an active pending medication or not.

columns.name: PEND_PREV_ORD_ID
columns.description: The previous order ID for the pending medication. This item is NOT networked to orders.

columns.name: ORD_TRANS_METHOD_C_NAME
columns.description: This item holds the method of transmission for a given order. It should only be set from within an order transmittal rule using the transmission method property (LRC 161).

columns.name: PROFILE_ONLY_RX_YN
columns.description: This item specifies whether the medication order is intended to be filled by the pharmacy immediately or should be filled later when requested by the patient. This flag can be set in order entry based on the order class or by selecting the 'profile only' checkbox in pharmacy order entry.

columns.name: DISP_QTY_REM
columns.description: Stores the remaining authorized quantity (in Written Dispense Quantity unit) that the pharmacist can dispense. It is used in Ambulatory Pharmacy to calculate the Refills Remaining.

columns.name: FREQ_UNSCHEDULED_C_NAME
columns.description: If the frequency is unscheduled, this column will store a 1. If the frequency is not unscheduled, this column will be blank.

columns.name: SIGN_ACTION_PEND_C_NAME
columns.description: Sign action for pended order.

columns.name: ORIG_MED_ID
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order medication ID.

columns.name: ORIG_DIS_DISP_QTY
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order discrete dispense quantity.

columns.name: ORIG_DISP_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order discrete dispense unit.

columns.name: ORIG_DAW_YN
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order 'dispense as written?' flag and is either yes or no.

columns.name: MED_DISC_REFILLS
columns.description: Saves the discrete medication refills information for the order.

columns.name: PRIORITIZED_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: Stores the prioritized instant for the result in UTC

columns.name: ORIG_RX_QUANTITY
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order quantity.

columns.name: ORIG_RX_DIRECTIONS
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication directions.

columns.name: ORIG_RX_PRE_PROV_ID
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order prescriber ID.

columns.name: PRESCRIP_EXP_DATE
columns.description: Contains the expiration date for the prescription.

columns.name: ORIG_RX_PHRM_ID
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the pharmacy

columns.name: ORIG_RX_PHRM_ID_PHARMACY_NAME
columns.description: The name of the pharmacy.

columns.name: PRINT_LOCAL_COPY_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether to print a copy of this order. 'Y' indicates to print a copy of this order.  'N' indicates not to print a copy of this order.

columns.name: ORDER_TIME
columns.description: The date and time when the medication order was placed.

columns.name: PAT_SIG_REPLY_C_NAME
columns.description: This column contains the user's response to the sig-related questions for previous sig reorder workflows. The sig is the description of how a medication is supposed to be administered which includes the dose and frequency.

columns.name: SIG_REVIEW_USER_ID
columns.description: Holds the user ID of the user who reviewed the patient sig for accuracy. The sig is the description of how a medication is supposed to be administered which includes the dose and frequency.

columns.name: SIG_REVIEW_USER_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

columns.name: SIG_REVIEW_INS_DTTM
columns.description: Holds the instant that the user took action on the patient sig in previous sig workflows. The sig is the description of how a medication is supposed to be administered which includes the dose and frequency.

columns.name: EPRES_DEST_C_NAME
columns.description: Indicates the destination of e-prescribing order. It will be set by an interface or the ambulatory pharmacy system. The item may not be populated for the old order records.

columns.name: INTERFACE_STAT_C_NAME
columns.description: This column stores the ID of the interface status of the order.

columns.name: WAS_FMLY_CHECKED_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether the medication order was compared to a formulary during signing. 'Y' indicates that the medication was compared to a payor-plan formulary, external formulary, or hospital formulary. 'N' or NULL indicates that the medication was not compared to a formulary. This does not indicate that the medication is or is not on any formulary, only that a formulary was checked for the medication.

columns.name: UNROUNDED_DOSE_MIN
columns.description: The unrounded dose of this order. If the dose has a range (e.g. 1-2 mg), this is the lower end of the range. If the dose does not have a range, then this will store the dose.

columns.name: UNROUND_DOSE_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description: The med & dose unit category ID for the unrounded dose of this order record.

columns.name: SEND_PA_REQ_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether a prior authorization request should be sent for a medication order when it is signed. 'Y' indicates that a prior authorization request should be sent. 'N' indicates that a prior authorization request should not be sent.

columns.name: DISCON_LOCAL_TIME
columns.description: This item stores the instant in the patient's local time zone that an order was discontinued.

columns.name: RX_REQUEST_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description: The prescription request type category ID for the order record

columns.name: ERX_ORD_NAME
columns.description: The name of an order that was electronically prescribed.

columns.name: PAIN_AGREEMENT_YN
columns.description: Stores whether or not there is a pain agreement with the patient effective at the time the order was placed.

columns.name: ORDER_INST_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The date and time the order was placed in UTC. This is the same as the data in ORDER_MED.ORDER_INST, but in UTC.

columns.name: ORDERED_DAYS_SUPPLY_PER_FILL
columns.description: The calculated minimum days supply of the medication ordered. The value for this item is calculated when the order is signed, or when the order is edited by the pharmacy.

columns.name: DISCON_PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: The encounter or visit in which the medication was discontinued.

columns.name: UNIQUE_ORDER_IDENTIFIER
columns.description: Order identifier that is unique for all deployments

columns.name: PRIORITIZED_INST_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: This item stores the prioritized instant (date and time) for an order in UTC time zone. It represents the most relevant date and time an action was taken on an order.

columns.name: PRIORITIZED_INST_DTTM
columns.description: This item stores the prioritized instant (date and time) for an order in local time zone. It represents the most relevant date and time an action was taken on an order.

columns.name: ORD_SIG_HAS_IOU_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether Indications of Use are present in the patient sig. 'Y' indicates Indications of Use are present in the patient sig. 'N' or NULL indicate that Indications of Use are not present in the patient sig.

columns.name: RX_WRITTEN_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The UTC instant of when the prescription was written

columns.name: SIG_TEXT
columns.description: Patient instructions for the prescription as entered by the user.

columns.name: WEIGHT_AT_RELEASE
columns.description: The patient's recorded weight in kilograms at the time the order was released.

columns.name: WEIGHT_REL_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description: The source category ID for the patient's recorded weight at the time the order was released.

columns.name: HEIGHT_AT_RELEASE
columns.description: The patient's recorded height in centimeters at the time the order was released.

columns.name: HEIGHT_REL_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description: The source category ID for the patient's recorded height at the time the order was released.

columns.name: BSA_AT_RELEASE
columns.description: The patient's calculated body surface area (BSA) in meters squared at the time the order was released.

columns.name: BSA_REL_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description: The source category ID for the patient's recorded body surface area (BSA) at the time the order was released.
entries: Based on weight and height measured in the past
Based on most recent measured weight and height (actual)
Based on ideal body weight and current/past measured height
Based on adjusted body weight and current/past measured height
Based on dosing weight and current/past measured height

merged.name: ORDER_MEDINFO
merged.description: The ORDER_MEDINFO table is an addendum table for ORDER_MED and enables you to report on detail medication information for each order in clinical system (prescriptions). We have also included patient and contact identification information for each record.

merged.name: ORDER_MED_2
merged.description:
This table enables you to report on medications ordered in EpicCare or Ambulatory Pharmacy (Prescriptions).





This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

merged.name: ORDER_MED_3
merged.description: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

merged.name: ORDER_MED_4
merged.description: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

merged.name: ORDER_MED_5
merged.description: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

merged.name: ORDER_MED_6
merged.description: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

merged.name: ORDER_MED_7
merged.description: This table enables you to report on medications ordered. This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

merged.name: ORDER_MED_SIG
merged.description: The ORDER_MED_SIG table stores the patient instructions for a prescription as entered by the user. The table should be used in conjunction with the ORDER_MED table which contains related medication, patient, and contact identification information you can report on.

merged.name: ORDER_MED_VITALS
merged.description: This table stores historical patient vitals information for each medication order at the time the order was released. It should only be used for reporting on whether or not vitals information had been entered at that point in time.

merged.name: ORDER_RXVER_NOADSN
merged.description: The ORDER_RXVER_NOADSN contains medication order verification information that has one value per order.

merged.name: ORDER_MED_MORPHINE_EQUIV
merged.description: This table stores virtual morphine equivalence items in ORD.

ORDER_MED.PHARMACY_ID_PHARMACY_NAME: CVS 17622 IN TARGET - MADISON, WI - 750 HILLDALE WAY
ORDER_MED.RSN_FOR_DISCON_C_NAME: * Patient refusal (sends cancel message to pharmacy)
ORDER_MED.BSA_REL_SOURCE_C_NAME: Based on most recent measured weight and height (actual)

ORDER_MED.SIG_TEXT: Take 1 (one) capsule by mouth nightly. Start with 10 mg at night; can increase to 20 mg after 1-2 weeks if no side effects

ORDER_MED.ORIG_RX_PHRM_ID_PHARMACY_NAME: WALGREENS DRUG STORE #06130 - MADISON, WI - 3700 UNIVERSITY AVE AT NEC OF MIDVALE & UNIVERSITY
ORDER_MED.SIG_TEXT: TAKE 1 CAPSULE BY MOUTH EVERY NIGHT. START WITH 1 CAPSULE AT NIGHT; CAN. INCREASE TO 2 CAPSULES AFTER 1-2 WEEKS IF NO SIDE EFFECTS
ORDER_MED.BSA_REL_SOURCE_C_NAME: Based on most recent measured weight and height (actual)

ORDER_MED.PHARMACY_ID_PHARMACY_NAME: COSTCO PHARMACY # 1020 - MIDDLETON, WI - 2150 DEMING WAY
ORDER_MED.BSA_REL_SOURCE_C_NAME: Based on most recent measured weight and height (actual)
